alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scott; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:14PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clark, southwestern Scott and southeastern Washington Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 213 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Salem. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Washington, northwestern Clark and southwestern Scott Counties in south central Indiana, including the following locations... Farabee, Chestnut Hill, Daisy Hill, Borden, Blue River, New Liberty and New Pekin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
